Description: (v26.1.a) AWS CFT to deploy a single AZ A-P solution, repo: https://github.com/FortinetCloudCSE/fortigate-aws-ha-singleaz-cloudformation

Label.default: Interface IP Configuration for the Cluster

VPCCIDR.Description: Provide a network CIDR for the new VPC
VPCCIDR.ConstraintDescription: Must be a valid CIDR block format.

AZForSubnet1.Description: Select an Availability Zone for the first set of new subnets

PublicSubnet1CIDR.ConstraintDescription: Must be a valid CIDR block format.

PrivateSubnet1CIDR.Description: Provide a network CIDR for PrivateSubnet1
PrivateSubnet1CIDR.ConstraintDescription: Must be a valid CIDR block format.

HAMgmtSubnet1CIDR.Description: Provide a network CIDR for HAMgmtSubnet1
HAMgmtSubnet1CIDR.ConstraintDescription: Must be a valid CIDR block format.

Attachment.Description: Select Yes if you plan to attach this VPC to Transit GW or Cloud WAN with a VPC attachment.  If Yes is selected 2 additional subnets and a route table will be created

AttachmentSubnet1CIDR.Description: Provide a network CIDR for AttachmentSubnet1
AttachmentSubnet1CIDR.ConstraintDescription: Must be a valid CIDR block format.

TgwCreation.Description: Select Yes if you want to deploy a new Transit GW and two Transit GW Route Tables

TgwExisting.Description: [Leave blank if an existing TGW will not be used] If you are using an existing Transit GW, provide the Transit GW ID to create VPC routes to reach it

TgwExistingSecurityTgwRtb.Description: [Leave blank if an existing TGW will not be used] If you are using an existing Transit GW, provide the Transit GW RouteTable ID for the security VPC to associate to

TgwExistingSpokeTgwRtb.Description: [Leave blank if an existing TGW will not be used] If you are using an existing Transit GW, provide the Transit GW RouteTable ID that your spoke VPCs are associated with

TgwExistingSpokeTgwRtbRoute.Description: [Leave blank if an existing TGW will not be used] If you are using an existing Transit GW, provide a network CIDR to create a route in your Transit GW RouteTable that your spoke VPCs are associated with (ie 10.0.0.0/8 or 0.0.0.0/0)

CwanCreation.Description: Select Yes if you want to deploy a new Cloud WAN network with production, development, sharedservices, and firewall segments

CwanExisting.Description: [Leave blank if an existing Cwan will not be used] If you are using an existing Cloud WAN, provide the Cloud WAN Core Network ID to create VPC routes to reach it

CwanExistingSegmentKey.Description: [Leave blank if an existing Cwan will not be used] Provide the name that should be used to create a Tag on the Cwan VPC Attachment to allow CWAN attachment automation

CwanExistingSegmentValue.Description: [Leave blank if an existing Cwan will not be used] Provide the value that should be used to create a Tag on the Cwan VPC Attachment to allow CWAN attachment automation

PublicSubnet1RouterIP.Description: Provide the IP address of the AWS intrinsic router (First Host IP from PublicSubnet1CIDR)
PublicSubnet1RouterIP.ConstraintDescription: Must be a valid IPv4 address in dotted-decimal format.

PrivateSubnet1RouterIP.Description: Provide the IP address of the AWS intrinsic router (First IP from PrivateSubnet1CIDR)
PrivateSubnet1RouterIP.ConstraintDescription: Must be a valid IPv4 address in dotted-decimal format.

HAMgmtSubnet1RouterIP.Description: Provide the IP address of the AWS intrinsic router (First IP from HAMgmtSubnet1CIDR)
HAMgmtSubnet1RouterIP.ConstraintDescription: Must be a valid IPv4 address in dotted-decimal format.

FortiGate1PublicIP.Description: Provide the IP address in CIDR form for the public interface of FortiGate1 (IP from PublicSubnet1CIDR)
FortiGate1PublicIP.ConstraintDescription: Must be a valid CIDR block format.

FortiGate1PrivateIP.Description: Provide the IP address in CIDR form for the private interface of FortiGate1 (IP from PrivateSubnet1CIDR)
FortiGate1PrivateIP.ConstraintDescription: Must be a valid CIDR block format.

FortiGate1HAmgmtIP.Description: Provide the IP address in CIDR form for the ha management interface of FortiGate1 (IP from HAMgmtSubnet1CIDR)
FortiGate1HAmgmtIP.ConstraintDescription: Must be a valid CIDR block format.

FortiGate2PublicIP.Description: Provide the IP address in CIDR form for the public interface of FortiGate2 (IP from PublicSubnet1CIDR)
FortiGate2PublicIP.ConstraintDescription: Must be a valid CIDR block format.

FortiGate2PrivateIP.Description: Provide the IP address in CIDR form for the private interface of FortiGate2 (IP from PrivateSubnet1CIDR)
FortiGate2PrivateIP.ConstraintDescription: Must be a valid CIDR block format.

FortiGate2HAmgmtIP.Description: Provide the IP address in CIDR form for the ha management interface of FortiGate2 (IP from HAMgmtSubnet1CIDR)
FortiGate2HAmgmtIP.ConstraintDescription: Must be a valid CIDR block format.

ClusterPublicIP.Description: Provide the IP address in CIDR form for the public interface of the Cluster (IP from PublicSubnet)
ClusterPublicIP.ConstraintDescription: must be a valid CIDR block format.

ClusterPrivateIP.Description: Provide the IP address in CIDR form for the private interface of the Cluster (IP from PrivateSubnet)
ClusterPrivateIP.ConstraintDescription: must be a valid CIDR block format.

InstanceType.Description: Select the instance type for the FortiGates

CIDRForInstanceAccess.Description: Provide a network CIDR from which the FortiGate instances will be accessed
CIDRForInstanceAccess.ConstraintDescription: Must be a valid CIDR block

KeyPair.Description: Select a keypair to associate with the FortiGates

EncryptVolumes.Description: Select 'true' to encrypt the FortiGate instances OS and Log volumes with your account's KMS default master key for EBS.  Otherwise select false to leave unencrypted

OnlyPrivateEC2API.Description: Select if only private EC2 API access is allowed for HAMgmt interfaces.  ***Note*** No EIP will be assigned to the HAMgmmt interfaces.  Login via the floating Cluster EIP or directly to each VM with the private IP of the HAMgmt interface.

InitS3Bucket.Description: [BYOL Only, leave blank otherwise] Provide the Init S3 Bucket name, where your config files will be created. ***Note*** the bucket should exist in the same region as this deployment for successful bootstrapping

FortiOSVersion.Description: Select the version of FortiOS to use (latest GA AMI will be used)

LicenseType.Description: Select the license type for the FortiGates

FortiGate1LicenseFile.Description: [BYOL Only, leave blank otherwise] Provide the name of the BYOL license file in the Init S3 Bucket for FortiGate1 (ie fgt1.lic or prefix/fgt1.lic)

FortiGate2LicenseFile.Description: [BYOL Only, leave blank otherwise] Provide the name of the BYOL license file in the Init S3 Bucket for FortiGate2 (ie fgt2.lic or prefix/fgt2.lic)

FortiGate1FortiFlexToken.Description: [Flex Only, leave blank otherwise] Provide the FortiFlex Token for FortiGate1 (ie 1A2B3C4D5E6F7G8H9I0J)

FortiGate2FortiFlexToken.Description: [Flex Only, leave blank otherwise] Provide the FortiFlex Token for FortiGate2 (ie 2B3C4D5E6F7G8H9I0J1K)

SecurityGroupIngress.Description: Allow local VPC access to FGT

Properties.Description: Allow FGTs to access each other

ClusterLoginURL.Description: Login URL for the public interface of the active FortiGate

FortiGate1LoginURL.Description: Login URL for the HAmgmt interface of FortiGate1

FortiGate2LoginURL.Description: Login URL for the HAmgmt interface of FortiGate2

TransitGateway.Description: Transit Gateway ID, for use in spoke template

TransitGatewaySecurityRtb.Description: Transit Gateway Route Table ID that the security VPC is associated to, for use in spoke template

TransitGatewaySpokeRtb.Description: Transit Gateway Route Table ID that the spoke VPCs will associate to, for use in spoke template

ExistingTransitGateway.Description: Existing Transit Gateway ID, for use in spoke template

ExistingTransitGatewaySecurityRtb.Description: Existing Transit Gateway Route Table ID that the security VPC is associated to, for use in spoke template

ExistingTransitGatewaySpokeRtb.Description: Existing Transit Gateway Route Table ID that the spoke VPCs will associate to, for use in spoke template

CloudWAN.Description: Cloud WAN Core Network ID, for use in spoke template

CloudWanSegmentKey.Description: Cloud WAN segment key, for use in spoke template

ClouCloudWanSegmentValue.Description: Cloud WAN segment value (use one of the examples), for use in spoke template

ExistingCloudWAN.Description: Existing Cloud WAN Core Network ID, for use in spoke template
